intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Pardon me, milord/milady. I've finished scouting the surrounding area.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you Kaze. How does it look?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: I'm afraid it's not good. I don't believe the Nohrian army is aware of our precise location, but... They have moved to block all possible routes to the castle. Even the back roads and trails. They are being quite thorough. There are thousands of troops massing.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thousands. And we are just a handful. Well, thank you again, Kaze, for taking on such a difficult scouting mission.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Of course, milord/milady. May I ask... How do you plan on proceeding? I don't see any way we can get around Nohr's forces undetected.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: There's really NO other route we can take?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: That's not entirely true.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh? Well, let's hear it! It doesn't look like we have any other options.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Technically speaking, it is possible to reach Nohr via Mount Garou. However, Mount Garou is more commonly known as the Impassable Peak.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: How can you even suggest such a thing, Lord Ryoma? We'd fare better against 10,000 Nohrian soldiers out in the open!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I am aware of the downside... and so is Nohr. That must be why they're forcing us in that direction.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Right. I didn't see any troops blocking the entrance to the peak... But that is surely intentional.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: What do you think, Corrin? This may be our best chance.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well, we can't just stay here. We're a small force, but we're powerful and nimble. I think we should take our chances with Garou.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Then it is agreed. Kaze, can you guide us to the best possible entry point?

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Of course, milord.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: *huff* *huff* *huff* First the Eternal Stairway...now this. At least we don't have to worry about staying in condition with all this exercise.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I'm afraid the physical demands of this peak aren't our only worry... How are you doing, Corrin? Do you need to take a break?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No, I'm OK. But it looks as though we've put some distance on the others. Perhaps we should give them a chance to catch up and rest.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Good idea. I'll backtrack a little bit and alert the leaders. Wait...someone else is here!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Where? I don't see anyone...

intro.speaker: Wolfskin
intro.line: Grrrr...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Watch out, Corrin!

intro.speaker: Wolfskin
intro.line: Grr... *snarl*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What are we dealing with, Ryoma? Another of Nohr's monsters?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: No, these are wolfskin—a tribe with shapeshifting abilities. They're the other hazard associated with crossing Mount Garou.

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Hey! What are you guys doing in our den?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm sorry...who are you?

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Me? Oh, my name's Keaton. And you CAN'T HAVE MY FUR, got it? Some other humans came and tried to get my fur. But I collected their bones instead. Ha! The joke's on them.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: He does appear to have a collection of human bones...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm sorry. I think there's been a misunderstanding. We're not after your fur. We just want to pass through the area. We mean you no harm!

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Really? How can I trust you? My fur is pretty soft, you know. A lot of people want it!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Please, believe me. We have no intention of fighting. Everyone! Set down your weapons.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I hope you know what you're doing, Corrin...

intro.speaker: Takumi
intro.line: Yeah, you better be right about this.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: There. You see, we're sorry about trespassing, but we come in peace. We'd just like to pass through this area.

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Wolfskin
intro.line: Grr!

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: All right, all right. I think they're telling the truth. Let's let these humans through.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you Keaton. We appreciate it.

intro.speaker: Wolfskin
intro.line: Gyaaah!

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: What was that?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Some kind of explosion! Everyone, get down!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Look, up there. What is that?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It looks like...dark energy. The same kind that exploded from my sword... Have we been set up by King Garon again?

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Hey! Hey! Wake up! This isn't funny, OK? Snap to it! Aww, open your eyes. Please? Not like this... *sniff* *sniff*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Oh dear.

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: YOU! You did this, didn't you? You were tricking us the whole time!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: No! That's not true. We had nothing to do with this!

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Lies! You'll die for this. ALL OF YOU!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Lord/Lady Corrin! Are you OK?

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: Gah! Get out of my way! This is between me and him/her.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Urgh...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kaze!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: I don't think we can talk our way out of this one, Lord/Lady Corrin. We're going to sustain heavy losses if we don't fight back.

intro.speaker: Keaton
intro.line: I knew I shouldn't have trusted humans. None of you are leaving this place alive!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Quickly, Lord/Lady Corrin! We need to take action one way or another.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Argh! I guess we have no choice... Please forgive us, wolfskin!

boss.speaker: Keaton
boss.line: Now I'll take your life in exchange for my friend's. Rawr!

boss.speaker: Keaton
boss.line: Ugh... Why did you have to come here...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: We owe the wolfskin an apology. As meaningless as they may believe it to be... We can't undo what happened here today.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: An apology may be in order, but we're not at fault here. Please don't be too hard on yourself about all of this.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I don't know. I'll never be able to fully forgive myself. I suppose it's just another burden I'll carry until the end.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Perhaps it's a burden I can help you carry, milord/milady.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Would you allow me to serve you?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: To...serve me? What do you mean?

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Ah, pardon me. Of course you wouldn't be familiar with Hoshidan tradition. It is expected that the most skilled elite soldiers will eventually choose a liege. As you're aware, Subaki and Hana serve Lady Sakura. Hinata and Oboro support Lord Takumi. Lady Hinoka counts on Azama and Setsuna as her retainers. And Kagero and my older brother Saizo work directly for Lord Ryoma.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, of course. I suppose I'm the only one left for you. Sorry about that.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: On the contrary. I feel blessed that I've remained unattached. Because now I can pledge my loyalty to you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kaze, are you sure?

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Yes. I've seen you make tough but necesary decisions in the face of danger. I'm confident that you're the right leader for our group in this time of crisis. Besides, I've done something to you that can never be forgiven...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: How could you possibly? I don't know what you're talking about.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Lord/Lady Corrin, allow me to explain. When I was much younger—

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Whoah, what's happening? I think it's a landslide! Watch out!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kaze! You have to let go of me! We'll both fall if you don't!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Ungh...never! I couldn't live with myself. I already owe you my life...I'm the reason you were kidnapped as a child!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That can't be true!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: It is. I was traveling with you that day, and I saw an unusual Nohrain troop presence. If I had only said something... But I was young... I didn't know the risk they posed. I could have prevented everything!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You were a child! You couldn't have known. It's not your fault!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: I wish you were right. But I was raised in a family of ninja. I should have known better. I owe you a lifetime of service. But perhaps sacrificing myself will do.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kaze, no! Don't do anything foolish!

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Corrin! Kaze! Hold on!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Over here, Hinoka. Please help!

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: I'm coming!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Agh...the ground is moving again!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: It has been a pleasure serving you, Lord/Lady Corrin. Lady Hinoka! You know what you have to do. Haaa!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Whoa!

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: I've got you, Corrin!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Please forgive me, Lord/Lady Corrin. I am only doing what is necessary.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: NO! Kaze!

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: I...I couldn't save him! What just happened?!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I can't belive it... Kaze, why? WHY?!

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Well, we've reached the summit. How are you doing, Corrin?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: We...we lost Kaze. I still can't believe it.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Yes. Another tragedy among countless tragedies we've witness of late. ... Look, Corrin. Can you see the sun breaking over the horizon?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes...I suppose I can.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: They say the sun never shines in Nohr, but we can see that that's not true. Perhaps it's small comfort, but I take this as a good omen.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It is warm here. The same kind of warmth I felt walking the streets of Hoshido. Perhaps Kaze's spirit lives on in another world, watching over us.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Anything is possible, Corrin.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you for saving me, Kaze. I promise that you won't have died in vain. rest in peace, friend...

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: I'll always be at your side—especially at times like this.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Kaze. Your words mean a lot to me.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Whoah, what's happening? I think it's a landslide! Watch out!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kaze! You have to let go of me! We'll both fall if you don't!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Never milord/milady! I won't let you die!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Hrrrgh! I can't hold this much longer... Hmm, is that what I think it is? Milord/Milady! I'm going to try something! Please hold tight!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: What?!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Hah!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: WHOA!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Are you all right, Lord/Lady Corrin?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes...I think I am. Thanks to you. What WAS that?

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: I...I don't know. I didn't know what would happen...but I'm afraid I didn't have many options.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I can't say I'm disappointed, but you should have let me go and saved yourself.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Nonsense. If anything, I was prepared to sacrifice myself. Hoshido needs you, Lord/Lady Corrin.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well...thank you.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Are you two OK? I heard what sounded like another explosion.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, we're fine Azura. Kaze managed to save us both.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Oh, thank goodness. I must admit, I feared the worst. Even though we're out of danger for now, it would be wise to stay alert.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Well, we've reached the summit. How are you doing, Corrin?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm still upset about what happened with the wolfskin. Not to mention the fact that Kaze and I just nearly died.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Yes. This clash with the wolfskin is just another tragedy in a long line. ... Look, Corrin. Can you see the sun breaking over the horizon?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes...I suppose I can.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: They say the sun never shines in Nohr, but we can see that that's not true. Perhaps it's small comfort, but I take this as a good omen.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It is warm here. The same kind of warmth I felt walking the streets of Hoshido. I hope someday, both Hoshido and Nohr can share this kind of warmth.

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Anything is possible, Corrin.

dialogue.speaker: Lilith
dialogue.line: Lady Corrin, could I have a moment of your time? There's a familiar face here to see you.

dialogue.speaker: Felicia
dialogue.line: Lady Corrin! I'm so glad you're safe! When I'd heard you'd gone missing I couldn't think about anything else! I've been tracking you down ever since, through the astral whosits! It wasn't easy, but I made it here and I want to fight!

dialogue.speaker: Jakob
dialogue.line: Lord Corrin, it's truly splendid to see you are doing well! When word reached us that you had gone missing, I could not rest. Tracking nobles across dimensional barriers was a new item for my résumé... But I am undoubtedly richer for it. Now that I am here, I would like to fight at your side.
